00:00:06:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:06:110000.Dialogue: LEONARD: It's just two degrees, Sheldon. I just want to turn up the thermostat two degrees!

00:00:11:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:11:020000.Dialogue: SHELDON: Let me point out that two degrees can be the difference between water and steam.

00:00:16:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:16:050000.Dialogue: LEONARD: Yes, if we lived in a teakettle.

00:00:18:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:18:110000.Dialogue: SHELDON: This is the temperature you agreed to in the roommate agreement.

00:00:21:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:21:130000.Dialogue: LEONARD: Aw, screw the roommate agreement!

00:00:23:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:23:130000.Dialogue: SHELDON: No, you don't screw the roommate agreement. The roommate agreement screws you.

00:00:28:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:28:080000.Dialogue: LEONARD: You know what, go to Hell and set their thermostat.

00:00:30:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:30:180000.Dialogue: SHELDON: I don't have to go to Hell. At 73 degrees, I'm there already!

00:00:49:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:49:080000.Dialogue: Can I sleep on your couch tonight?

00:00:51:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:51:180000.Dialogue: Uh, well, you can try, but the people across the hall are being very noisy.

00:00:57:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:00:57:160000.Dialogue: Apparently, the one fella tried to adjust the thermostat, then the other fella went bat-crap crazy.

00:01:05:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:05:120000.Dialogue: Well, not as nuts as the guy who chooses to live with him.

00:01:08:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:08:170000.Dialogue: Believe it or not, he was worse when I met him.

00:01:10:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:01:10:190000.Dialogue: Oh, I do not believe that.

00:01:13:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:13:040000.Dialogue: You are so naive. Just like I was seven years ago. I'd just started at the university.

00:01:26:110000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:01:26:110000.Dialogue: Excuse me, I'm looking for Sheldon Cooper's apartment.

00:01:30:150000.Speaker: Man with a box
00:01:30:150000.Dialogue: Oh, I bet you're here to check out the room for rent.

00:01:40:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:40:220000.Dialogue: That should have been my first clue.

00:02:10:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:10:230000.Dialogue: So Sheldon's last roommate tried to warn you off?

00:02:13:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:13:180000.Dialogue: For all I knew, he was the crazy one.

00:02:17:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:17:020000.Dialogue: He had this really deranged look.

00:02:19:140000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:19:140000.Dialogue: Well, yeah, he'd been living with Sheldon.

00:02:28:040000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:02:28:040000.Dialogue: Anyway, I went upstairs and knocked on the door.

00:02:49:040000.Speaker: Transvestite
00:02:49:040000.Dialogue: No, you want the crazy guy across the hall.

00:02:56:020000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:02:56:020000.Dialogue: In retrospect, that was clue number two.

00:03:07:010000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:03:07:010000.Dialogue: I'm Leonard Hofstadter. I called you about the apartment. You said...

00:03:10:110000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:03:10:110000.Dialogue: I know what I said. I know what you said. I know what my mother said on March 5, 1992.

00:03:16:120000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:03:16:120000.Dialogue: What is the sixth noble gas?

00:03:24:070000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:03:24:070000.Dialogue: Are you asking me or telling me?

00:03:34:090000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:03:34:090000.Dialogue: All right, next question. Kirk or Picard?

00:03:38:060000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:03:38:060000.Dialogue: Oh, uh, well, that's tricky. Um, Original Series over Next Generation, but Picard over Kirk.

00:03:49:020000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:03:49:020000.Dialogue: You've passed the first barrier to roommate-hood.

00:03:53:180000.Speaker: Past Leonard (Enters apartment. It is bare except for two lawn chairs, a television and some whiteboards)

00:04:03:090000.Speaker: Past Leonard (Enters apartment. It is bare except for two lawn chairs, a television and some whiteboards)
00:04:03:090000.Dialogue: Uh, the bedrooms are back there?

00:04:06:180000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:04:06:180000.Dialogue: I don't understand-- their existence is conditional?

00:04:10:060000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:04:10:060000.Dialogue: No, but your ability to perceive their existence is conditional on you passing the second and third barriers.

00:04:17:190000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:04:17:190000.Dialogue: Each more daunting than the last.

00:04:32:050000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:04:32:050000.Dialogue: This seat is ideally located both in relation to the heat source in the winter and a cross breeze in the summer. It also faces the television at a direct angle-- allowing me to immerse myself in entertainment or game play without being subjected to conversation. As a result, I've placed it in a state of eternal dibs.

00:04:57:050000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:04:57:050000.Dialogue: That's Latin for "my chair, my rules."

00:05:01:190000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:05:01:190000.Dialogue: Now, you said on the phone that your area of study is physics.

00:05:13:180000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:05:13:180000.Dialogue: Doesn't concern you. You'll be going to the university every day?

00:05:18:180000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:05:18:180000.Dialogue: And you have a vehicle? A car, yeah.

00:05:20:010000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:05:20:010000.Dialogue: And you'll be willing to drive me?

00:05:29:000000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:05:29:000000.Dialogue: Okay, I suppose I could drive you. That's a point in my favor, right?

00:05:34:230000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:05:34:230000.Dialogue: Why don't you let me do this.

00:05:43:150000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:05:43:150000.Dialogue: Last question. In a post-apocalyptic world, which task would you assign the highest priority? Locating a sustainable food source, reestablishing a functioning government, procreating, or preserving the knowledge of mankind?

00:05:55:210000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:05:55:210000.Dialogue: Uh, I'm gonna go with... preserving the knowledge.

00:06:01:160000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:06:01:160000.Dialogue: FYI, I would have accepted any answer other than procreating.

00:06:07:040000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:06:07:040000.Dialogue: Come, I'll show you the rest of the apartment.

00:06:09:090000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:06:09:090000.Dialogue: Oh, good. I passed the barriers.

00:06:11:200000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:06:11:200000.Dialogue: The second barrier. Don't get cocky.

00:06:16:230000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:06:16:230000.Dialogue: This is the bathroom. Are you fairly regular?

00:06:25:220000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:06:25:220000.Dialogue: This isn't going to work if you're guessing.

00:06:29:030000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:06:29:030000.Dialogue: When do you evacuate your bowels?

00:06:34:080000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:06:34:080000.Dialogue: When you have to? I'm sorry, I don't rent to hippies.

00:06:41:120000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:06:41:120000.Dialogue: I-I'm sorry, uh, in the morning. Around 8:00.

00:06:44:160000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:06:44:160000.Dialogue: I can't give you 8:00. I can give you 7:30.

00:06:50:120000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:06:50:120000.Dialogue: Third barrier passed. You have won the right to see your room. Huzzah.

00:07:01:180000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:07:01:180000.Dialogue: No, this is my room. People don't go in my room.

00:07:10:030000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:07:10:030000.Dialogue: If people don't go in there, and you're people, and... You are people, aren't you?

00:07:41:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:07:41:060000.Dialogue: And after all that, you just moved in?

00:07:44:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:44:100000.Dialogue: I didn't just move in. First we had to iron out a few details.

00:07:47:160000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:07:47:160000.Dialogue: "Roommates agree that Friday nights shall be reserved "for watching Joss Whedon's brilliant new series Firefly."

00:07:54:190000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:07:54:190000.Dialogue: Does that really need to be in the agreement?

00:07:58:010000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:07:58:010000.Dialogue: We might as well settle it now; it's going to be on for years.

00:08:01:210000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:08:01:210000.Dialogue: Initial here. All right, that's television and movies.

00:08:11:020000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:08:11:020000.Dialogue: Section nine: miscellany. The apartment's flag is a gold lion rampant on a field of azure.

00:08:34:160000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:08:34:160000.Dialogue: Unless the apartment's in distress. And next. "If either of us ever invents time travel, "we agree our first stop will be this meeting today in precisely five seconds."

00:09:04:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:04:180000.Dialogue: Why on earth did you agree to all that?

00:09:06:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:06:230000.Dialogue: It was the best apartment I'd seen, the rent was very reasonable and after you've passed the first three barriers you kind of want to take it all the way.

00:09:15:000000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:15:000000.Dialogue: Well, I'm sorry, Leonard, it's very hard to feel sympathy for you.

00:09:19:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:19:190000.Dialogue: Okay, how about this? Let me tell you about the first time I brought a girl over.

00:09:26:120000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:09:26:120000.Dialogue: Shh. Just pretend we're not here.

00:09:37:120000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:09:37:120000.Dialogue: I'm just going to keep knocking till you answer. (knocking) Leonard? (knocking) Leonard? (knocking) Leonard?

00:09:44:090000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:09:44:090000.Dialogue: What do you want?! I didn't say come in!

00:09:48:020000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:09:48:020000.Dialogue: You asked what I wanted. I wanted to come in.

00:09:51:150000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:09:51:150000.Dialogue: I'm here because you violated our roommate agreement. Specifically, section eight-- visitors, subsection C; females, paragraph four-- coitus.

00:10:01:030000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:10:01:030000.Dialogue: "Roommates shall give each other 12 hours notice of impending coitus."

00:10:06:170000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:10:06:170000.Dialogue: I didn't even know her 12 hours ago.

00:10:09:220000.Speaker: Joyce Kim
00:10:09:220000.Dialogue: That's it! I'm out of here!

00:10:18:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:18:170000.Dialogue: Do I get some sympathy now?

00:10:26:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:26:030000.Dialogue: Okay. Let me get this straight. You move in with this guy, he makes you sign a ridiculous roommate agreement, then he walks into your bedroom while you're doing this Joyce Kim, and you still stay?

00:10:35:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:35:120000.Dialogue: Actually, I couldn't get too mad at him about Joyce Kim.

00:10:39:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:39:140000.Dialogue: Well, I was doing some government research at the time, you know, military, rocket fuel. It's kind of secret.

00:10:45:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:45:090000.Dialogue: What does that have to do with Joyce Kim?

00:10:47:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:47:040000.Dialogue: As it turns out, she was a North Korean spy.

00:10:51:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:51:210000.Dialogue: Luckily, Sheldon drove her out before I revealed anything important. Which I-I'm not saying I would have.

00:10:59:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:59:190000.Dialogue: So, what, that's it? You've stayed with Sheldon all this time because he kept you from going to federal prison?

00:11:04:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:04:130000.Dialogue: That was part of it. The other part is what happened with the elevator.

00:11:08:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:11:08:160000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah, I'm wondering about that. You said it was working when you moved in.

00:11:11:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:11:160000.Dialogue: It was, but one night, Sheldon came home from work...

00:11:26:200000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:11:26:200000.Dialogue: Hey, Sheldon. This is Howard and Raj. They work at the university, too.

00:11:35:210000.Speaker: Past Howard
00:11:35:210000.Dialogue: I can't speak for these guys, but I'm sitting on my tushie.

00:11:50:150000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:11:50:150000.Dialogue: Oh, well, there were some people on the first floor moving out, and they sold it to me for $100. Howard and Raj helped me bring it up.

00:11:56:010000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:11:56:010000.Dialogue: But what's wrong with the furniture we have?

00:12:02:000000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:12:02:000000.Dialogue: And there was no place for company.

00:12:03:170000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:12:03:170000.Dialogue: Did it occur to you that was by design?

00:12:07:090000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:12:07:090000.Dialogue: According to the roommate agreement, I'm entitled to allocate 50% of the cubic footage of the common areas.

00:12:12:190000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:12:12:190000.Dialogue: But you didn't notify me by e-mail, so this is still a breach.

00:12:39:200000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:12:39:200000.Dialogue: Hoisted by my own spam filter.

00:12:43:010000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:12:43:010000.Dialogue: What am I doing in your spam folder?

00:12:45:010000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:12:45:010000.Dialogue: I put you there after you forwarded me a picture of a cat playing the piano, entitled "This is funny."

00:12:50:180000.Speaker: Past Raj
00:12:50:180000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah, I saw that. That was hilarious.

00:12:54:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:54:130000.Dialogue: Okay, what does all this have to do with the elevator?

00:12:57:180000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:12:57:180000.Dialogue: I assure you, you'll be sorry you wasted your money on an iPod when Microsoft comes out with theirs.

00:13:06:120000.Speaker: Past Raj
00:13:06:120000.Dialogue: Okay, do you have an opinion about everything?

00:13:11:170000.Speaker: Past Howard
00:13:11:170000.Dialogue: And you just assume you're always right?

00:13:27:190000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:13:27:190000.Dialogue: We don't watch Babylon 5 in this apartment.

00:13:35:210000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:13:35:210000.Dialogue: There you go-- three against one.

00:13:37:110000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:13:37:110000.Dialogue: They don't get a vote. It's one against one. And according to the roommate agreement, all ties will be settled by me.

00:13:44:160000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:13:44:160000.Dialogue: But I said no to that.

00:13:55:060000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:13:55:060000.Dialogue: Change seats with me. Why? There's a draft on my neck over here.

00:14:16:200000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:14:16:200000.Dialogue: Hmm... I'm still not comfortable. Of course. There's too many people here.

00:14:26:060000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:14:26:060000.Dialogue: We can fix that. Let's leave.

00:14:29:100000.Speaker: Past Howard
00:14:29:100000.Dialogue: Yeah, we can go over to my place.

00:14:31:180000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:14:31:180000.Dialogue: Wait. Let me get my jacket.

00:14:38:150000.Speaker: Past Raj
00:14:38:150000.Dialogue: You're the guy we're trying to get away from.

00:14:43:060000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:14:43:060000.Dialogue: Well, in that case, I don't need my jacket.

00:14:47:000000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:14:47:000000.Dialogue: And for the record, the correct syntax is: I'm the guy from whom you're trying to get away.

00:15:05:200000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:15:05:200000.Dialogue: This is definitely going to be my spot.

00:15:08:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:08:190000.Dialogue: PENNY: Okay. How do you know he said that? You left the room.

00:15:12:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:12:040000.Dialogue: Hey, do you want me to finish working on your man feet or not?

00:15:19:080000.Speaker: MRS. WOLOWITZ
00:15:19:080000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ (shouting): Howard, are you having a playdate?

00:15:22:140000.Speaker: Past Howard
00:15:22:140000.Dialogue: I don't have playdates! I have colleagues!

00:15:26:140000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:15:26:140000.Dialogue: Do their parents know they're here?

00:15:30:050000.Speaker: Past Howard
00:15:30:050000.Dialogue: No, but if you keep screaming, maybe they'll hear you!

00:15:42:070000.Speaker: Past Howard
00:15:42:070000.Dialogue: She grows any more hair on her face, yes.

00:15:46:120000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:15:46:120000.Dialogue: Oh, man. Is that a two-stage rocket?

00:15:49:170000.Speaker: Past Howard
00:15:49:170000.Dialogue: Three. I designed the engine myself.

00:15:54:160000.Speaker: Past Howard
00:15:54:160000.Dialogue: Oh, probably, if I could get my hands on that new fuel the government's been working on.

00:15:59:160000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:15:59:160000.Dialogue: Oh, this just might be your lucky day.

00:16:01:160000.Speaker: Mrs Wolowitz
00:16:01:160000.Dialogue: MRS. WOLOWITZ: Howard, what happened to the Oreos I left on the counter?!

00:16:07:200000.Speaker: Past Howard
00:16:07:200000.Dialogue: I haven't seen your Oreos! Just take your bath without them!

00:16:18:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:18:070000.Dialogue: So, why was it his lucky day?

00:16:19:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:19:230000.Dialogue: Well, it turns out I had a little rocket fuel in the apartment.

00:16:22:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:22:060000.Dialogue: What were you doing with rocket fuel in your apartment?

00:16:24:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:24:230000.Dialogue: Mm, Joyce Kim was kind of curious about what I did for a living, and I was going to kind of show it to her.

00:16:32:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:32:210000.Dialogue: It's not important. The point is, the guys and I went back to the apartment.

00:16:36:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:36:030000.Dialogue: Are we ever going to get to the elevator?

00:16:37:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:37:170000.Dialogue: Yeah, we're really close. Uh, uh, we're at the apartment.

00:16:39:220000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:16:39:220000.Dialogue: The trick is to mix it into Tovex in order to create a combustible gel that will generate over 8,000 kilonewtons of thrust.

00:16:50:170000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:16:50:170000.Dialogue: Excuse me, but I've been working on this a long time. Trust me-- it'll work.

00:16:54:160000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:16:54:160000.Dialogue: You don't see your mistake, do you?

00:16:58:090000.Speaker: Past Sheldon
00:16:58:090000.Dialogue: This is for a full-scale rocket, not a model.

00:17:05:010000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:17:05:010000.Dialogue: Okay, I've had it with you. You might be an expert on theoretical physics and science-fiction programs and where to sit on a freaking couch, but this is applied physics. And when it comes to applied physic... uh-oh.

00:17:19:120000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:17:19:120000.Dialogue: A bad thing. A very bad thing. Get the door. Get the door! Get the door! Get the door! Get the door!

00:17:51:100000.Speaker: Past Leonard
00:17:51:100000.Dialogue: What'd you do that for? I had plenty of time...

00:18:03:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:03:080000.Dialogue: Not only did Sheldon save my life, he didn't rat me out to the landlord. Or the police. Or Homeland Security.

00:18:10:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:10:120000.Dialogue: Okay, so, basically, you're the reason I have to walk up and down three flights of stairs every day?

00:18:15:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:15:050000.Dialogue: So I did something stupid. I'm sure you did stupid things when you were younger. What were you doing seven years ago?

00:18:20:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:20:010000.Dialogue: Excuse me, I was in high school. Studying, keeping my nose clean, doing volunteer work for the community.

00:18:38:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:38:200000.Dialogue: Oh, Ubuntu, you are my favorite Linux-based operating system.

00:18:46:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:46:100000.Dialogue: Hello. Why do I smell methacrylate?

00:18:51:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:51:140000.Dialogue: Oh, uh, clear nail polish. I had a mani-pedi.

00:18:59:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:59:000000.Dialogue: Anyway, I may owe you an apology.

00:19:03:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:03:230000.Dialogue: I did agree to the thermostat setting, and I shouldn't have tried to change it.

00:19:07:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:07:200000.Dialogue: That's not an apology. Simply an acknowledgement that I was right.

00:19:20:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:20:040000.Dialogue: Never mind. Okay if I watch some TV?

00:19:32:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:32:190000.Dialogue: LEONARD: Oh, so the dialogue offends you?

00:19:34:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:34:170000.Dialogue: SHELDON: I would hardly call that dialogue!

00:19:36:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:36:220000.Dialogue: LEONARD: You're insane, you know that?!

00:19:38:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:38:090000.Dialogue: SHELDON: Don't make me turn that flag upside down,
